body_html:
cool!

just a note: stan by default uses nuts, which is a powerful adaptive extension of hmc. this algorithm is arguably what makes stan's sampling option work so well "straight out of the box".

here's the paper for nuts (matt d hoffman and andrew gelman):

http://www.jmlr.org/papers/volume15/hoffman14a/hoffman14a.pdf

cool!

just a note: stan by default uses nuts, which is a powerful adaptive extension of hmc. this algorithm is arguably what makes stan's sampling option work so well "straight out of the box". 

here's the paper for nuts (matt d hoffman and andrew gelman): 

http://www.jmlr.org/papers/volume15/hoffman14a/hoffman14a.pdf
